intro: Fimbristylis hatsusimae, commonly known as the Hatsusima sedge, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in shaded environments. It has slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowering spikes are usually small and inconspicuous, producing tiny, three-lobed flowers.
